lines.text: I ate garbage last night, Barbara... and *loved* it!
You could have pissed right here!
Dave, he did! He pissed all over the joint.
Has there been some recent change in living arrangements?

[flatly]
We have a houseguest.
Oh.
[looks at Jerry]
How long are you staying?
He's staying as long as he likes. And if the doggy doesn't like it, then the doggy can find other living arrangements.
Would you like some wine, Al?
No, thank you. This is one of my non-drinking days.
Got a license?
Yeah.

[hands him the keys]
You drive.
Okay. Where to?
I don't know. Some days you just want to go, you know?
Okay. Let's hit the beach. I got some friends down there.
The beach?
[laughs]
Who's going to run my business? Who's going to pay my bills? Who's...

[interrupting]
You got enough money to last *ten* lifetimes!

[laughs heartily]
Yeah... maybe *I* ought to become a bum. No job, no responsibilities...

[snorts]
You wouldn't last five minutes.
You think so? Let's hit the beach, buddy. Pronto!
Hey. You, uh, haven't said anything about the car.
It's nice.
Yeah? You don't think it's, uh, too Beverly Hills?
Daddy, you work very hard for your money. You don't have to justify anything.
I know, it's just that, you know... maybe I'm feeling a little guilty.
Guilt sucks.
Max, I think it's time you stopped all this screwing around and started to learn the hanger business.
I don't like hangers.
You don't like hangers? It's hangers that clothe you, and it's hangers that feed you!

[Barb is visibly smashed]
Hey, Barb?
Mmmmmm?
I thought we weren't going to drink any more.
Well, Dave, yeah. It's true. I *am* a vegetarian. But I hear... that vodka... comes from a potato!
Oh, come on! The dog is running the whole house!
Someone's pissing on my hydrangeas!
Eating again, Dave? Well, it's your colon.
